Frédéric Chopin

Mazurka in B-flat major, KK Ve/4

1835 · Chomiński – · Brown –

This is an arrangement by Chopin of part of the Mazurka Dąbrowskiego, a well-known song that later became the Polish national anthem. Chopin’s arrangement is eight-bars long and incomplete, but can work effectively if repeated and concluded on the final B-flat major chord. The Kobylańska catalogue describes this piece as lost, but this is no longer the case.

Recommended editions

  • National Edition · 37 (Supplement) · ed. Jan Ekier

Duration: 0' 30"

Difficulty: 2
